website_summaries.verdict: This basic corded model is the perfect choice for consumers with minor trimming and edging jobs who are looking to save money.
pros: Though it has ample power, it is great for users who need a model that is extremely easy to control
cons: An obvious drawback is that the power cord makes it impractical for many tasks and locations
Lacks the advanced features of other models

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much for the price but unfortunately this is a total waste of money. As other reviewers have pointed out, it flies through replacement line. There is a plastic part (shown on manual) that regulates the auto-feed function of the trimmer. Thin, cheap plastic. So my trimmer is useless after one season. I implore you my fellow Amazon buyers, buy a different trimmer. BTW, my purchase was probably a year ago and I don't know if I'll still be a certified buyer but I did buy it from Amazon so please be assured this is an authentic and sincere review
customer_reviews.author: A. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price (One minor problem)
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price! Only problem was the extension cord didn't quite fit into it. I bought a 100 ft traditional orange extension cord and had to slightly trim some rubber off the end for it to fit into the trimmer. Other than that it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Boland

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as previous GH900. Cheap, thin plastic throughout the new version.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a GH900 thinking it would be the same as my previous one. I had a GH900 for 2 years before it burned out, which was not bad for the price. The one I just received is cheaply constructed with thin lightweight plastic used throughout. The black handle does not stay locked in place. The entire handle would bend where it connects to the orange shaft. Lucky I saved my old one in case I need repair parts. I didn't think I would need to be fixing it the first day I used it. The new unit is overall lighter than the old one, but I would prefer durability over weight loss. We'll see how long this one lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. Sharpie

customer_reviews.title: Blew apart on third use.
customer_reviews.text: Ok loved this little trimmer at first. Easy to use, line fairly priced. On third use the bottom blow apart as the cover for the line worn thru and everything went flying. I gave a small yard and maybe 100 feet total of cement curb to trim. The bottom wore down from just the surface contact. Very very low plastic quality. Amazon sells the replacement cap in 3 packs. Guess product requires frequent replacement. Never had a trimmer needing this replaced after 3 uses.
customer_reviews.author: SteveinSC

customer_reviews.title: You'll spend a FORTUNE feeding line to it.
customer_reviews.text: It runs through line way, way, way too fast. I fed it 2 spools of B&D wound line, and 2 of my own windings in a single session. I'm considering just sending it back. This is a really bad buy.
customer_reviews.author: M Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Worst string trimer ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst string trimer ever. The auto feed system sucks. I'm on my 4th spool of string. It seems to just constantly feed string. After burning through 3 factory replacement spools. I tried winding my own spool. Must have did it wrong because the auto feed jamed. Everytime I needed new string. I had to open the head and manually advance the string. But it lasted 3 times as long. Im positive black an decker. Designed the auto feed to use string fast. Forcing you to spend more money on replacement spools.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Money pit, and in the trash before 2 seasons
customer_reviews.text: It only lasted a season and a half before something interior broke, and the string inside came loose and started wrapping around itself. Seems to be something I can't easily replace, so it's in the trash. This thing is pretty junky to begin with and ate up TONS of string while I used it. I spent too much money on string. Next time I'll look for one without the auto feed, and definitely not a black and decker.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Spend a little more for something better if you can
customer_reviews.text: This is really only suitable for a shorter person with a tiny yard and a lot of patience. It doesn't lock into place, it's always loose and sliding out of place. The wanna-be edger part will do okay once you get a feel for it, but only if you have about 20 reams of line for it (line that fits this is so thin and weak it breaks constantly and is all gone about every 15 feet. There's no heavy duty line in a size of .070 like this weedeater requires.) If I had a bigger budget for this I woulda gotten something more substantial for my little suburban yard... this is way overpriced for its abilities.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Auto feed stinks
customer_reviews.text: The auto feed part of this makes it bad. Spits out either too much or not enough. The thing has a mind of its own.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle

customer_reviews.title: Runs out of Spool when Trimming the edges of lawn
customer_reviews.text: I have the original pricey B&D spool (auto feed) gone in few minutes. If the spool hits the cement edge of the lawn, autofeed consumes a ton of spool. For cutting the weed, it is OK. I need this as an edge trimmer and this does a very poor job per each spool roll you buy. I hardly need to cut 50 feet and I have to be careful not to touch the cement edges of lawn/walkway border. Overall, this autofeed is a total loss. It costs too much to replace the spools
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: The mailman brought this weed eater as I was doing yard work. I took a break, read the instructions and assembled it. I was able to use it in the back yard, but in the front yard, the head flew apart into multiple pieces while I was cutting weeds by the side of the house. I boxed it up, and returned it to Amazon the next week. Because of the head flying apart, I do not recommend this string trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Whit

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last 6 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to trim for my son who has a very small back yard. The trimmer has no power even for light jobs. Return window is closed. Only 30 days. Used it about 6 times and constantly had problems with the feed head. Brittle parts and the line spools are very fragile. Visited him today and he told me it hasn’t worked soon after I sent it to him. Tried to eliminate the need for fuel mix with a corded trimmer. Eh. I can’t recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Nato

customer_reviews.title: Spool wears out very quickly. My yard is not ...
customer_reviews.text: Spool wears out very quickly. My yard is not large, but the spool did not last thru two mowings. Does not feed properly. Requires repeated removing of the spool cap and extending the trim line. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Ed M.

customer_reviews.title: BUY EXTRA SPOOLS FOR THE TRIMMER
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my old B&D. It operates the same but has an added feature that assists in trimming near walls and along the sidewalk. I like the way it works and recommend it to anyone looking for a corded string trimmer. The spool of trimmer line that was include on the trimmer did not have very much string, probably only about 10 feet. The spool also was configured so that only a minimum amount of string could be reloaded on it. B&D needs to furnish more string with the trimmer as they furnished with my original one.
customer_reviews.author: Hardy Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers, I had to return this because string feeder didn't work. When you first started, it did OK, not great, but OK, but then the string didn't feed and you had to keep stopping to fix it. I bought a different brand 7AMP and it's doing just fine, so it's no my grass, weeds, etc... it was a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: The Ultimate Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I'm 74 and do my own mowing, edging, and blowing and this trimmer is amazing. My neighbor who is even older has one and I was hooked watching her. I discovered I could buy the bulk string and wind my own spools. It's actually fun to zip around my edges. I'm glad I got the more powerful model. It never stalls, It gives a beautiful clean edge. It's very light weight. Who needs a gardener?
customer_reviews.author: Swan Girl

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working after two years.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about you, but I think two years and it's done is ridiculous. I took it apart, cleaned it, checked wires, looked good but I'm no expert on machines. It all looked connected and it still doesn't work. Just stopped.....
customer_reviews.author: S. Altenau

customer_reviews.title: This unit calls for a 14 gauge 10 amp outdoor ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit calls for a 14 gauge 10 amp outdoor flat cord. Such a thing does not exist. Hence the early burn out I read about in previous reviews. Left hand has no clue what the right hand is doing and doesn't care. If you find such a cord that doesn't attach to an awkward reel, post it for future consumers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for left hand and right handed.  Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Super handy to have. Light weight and small. Good on small jobs and heavy jobs. The line is easy to replace and I have never had to go in and reset it in the middle of weed wacking. Black & Decker stands behind their products. I have had a good experience with warranty replacements in the past and my neighbor has been using Black&Decker for a longer time and more frequent and said they were good about honoring their warranties.
customer_reviews.author: zachary witte

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for women
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. So light and easy to use. My old one crapped out after about 18 months and we bought a legit weed eater with gas and choke and the whole nine. Hated it. I was terrified of the thing and refused to use it. I came and bought another of these. The are cheap enough I don’t mind replacing them frequently. The spools are a little pricey since they don’t last very long and seem to always be sold out at Lowe’s so make sure you get some of those too and keep on hand
customer_reviews.author: Brandi R. King

customer_reviews.title: Starts every time without pulling a cord, just squeeze!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than the gas powered model I was using, and a lot easier on my back. The 100 foot cord is still a pain to deal with I don't have to install a new spark plug, mix fresh gas, endure the noise and smoke or risk burning down my garage. It starts every time I squeeze the button and I have better control of the cutter speed. The " automatic line feed" sucks but I now brush on some rubber cement every row of line when I load it onto the reel. So far so good. Lots of power! You can definitely do some damage if you are not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Shooter 60

customer_reviews.title: Weed eater literally burned up on normal grass third use.
customer_reviews.text: It's basic, I don't expect much. However, I did expect it to be able to trim normal grass on occasion for a season. Instead, the third time edging grass on a normal size yard it implodes... The part that kills me, kind of like grass killed my weed eater, is that it wasn't even tough weeds just normal grass that ate the weed eater. That's like a rabbit eating a wolf... so wrong. You can vaguely see that last of the smoke wafting away as the grass stares murderously at it from the background.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Uses trimmer line faster than I could replace the spool
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 4 B&D trimmers over the years. They all had a particular life span and I was well satisfied with their performance. This current model gh900 was using up trimmer line faster that I could put it in. With my other models I could trim my property entirely on about half of a spool. This model I went through 2 spools and I was only about a quarter finished. At about $5 a spool this is crazy. I will search for another trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeni Tyrell

customer_reviews.title: The box had been opened and retaped
customer_reviews.text: I received the weed eater in a box that had been opened and the taped shut. The weed eater guard bag was torn open and the instructions were loose in the box. I purchased a new weed eater, but that is not what I received. It is obvious that I have received a returned product. Amazon is easy, but sometimes it is worth the trip to see what you are purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Abuelo Duane

customer_reviews.title: Maintenance of large property
customer_reviews.text: I mow, trim and edge 2/3 of an acre, so I need a weed-eater that doesn't take a rocket scientist to operate. Trimming is outstanding feature. I'm still in the learning phase for the edging feature. I really appreciate the auto-extend of the trimmer line. The weight of the trimmer is a concern as it relates to my age and mobility. By the same token, though, the power of it is worth the challenges at operation time. There have been many weed eaters before this one. I wouldn't purchase anything but a Black and Decker.
customer_reviews.author: ibpam

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the batter-powered units
customer_reviews.text: The first electric weed eater I purchased was a Black & Decker battery-powered unit. It was weak and ran out of juice before I was halfway done with the yard. I returned it the next day. This unit, also by the same company, has been great. It strikes a nice compromise between light and powerful. It'll eat through most of what you pit it against, but it's light and easy to carry around. B&D sells some replacement cord cartridges, but they're expensive for what they are. I purchasedto refill the cord, which has been a cost-effective alternative.
customer_reviews.author: B. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Beats battery operated
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my battery operated version of this weed-eater because I had a lot of trouble keeping a charge. Provided you have the proper extension cord(s) this one gives you a lot more power and easily knocks everything to the ground. The one twist edger is great for sidewalks and patios too. One thing...I'm having trouble with the self feeding function. I am sure I am threading it right but I have to make sure I am not using the wire for the last weed-eater before I say it is a problem you will have.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Black & Decker has yet to disappoint!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older B&D trimmer that had been handed down to me and finally saw its day. The old one worked great and this one is even BETTER. It arrived early on the day it was promised, so kudos to the seller's shipping team. Attach the handle and guard and that's it, you're ready to go. I gave it a quick test and was impressed even with the trigger. The wheel is a nice touch, my old machine didn't have one and definitely makes it a little easier to do the edging. *** I purchased this item at a discounted price in return for an honest and unbiased review***
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great little trimmer. Quick assembly with only 1 screw to install.
customer_reviews.text: Great little trimmer. Quick assembly with only 1 screw. No string winding necessary. You just purchase a set of pre-wound little cartridges to replace as they run out of string. A little more expensive but extremely convenient. This is my 2nd purchase of this trimmer model. Its light, works well and last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainPico

customer_reviews.title: Just OK.
customer_reviews.text: I've used several trimmers over the years, this one isn't my favorite, but it gets the job done. -1 star for the auto-feed design. It well let out a bunch of line if the line is wrapping around something, like a pole. When I'm not careful, that long line, when cut, will whip me right in the ankle -- not fun if you're not wearing long pants. -1 star for handle slippage. The handle is adjustable but has the tendency to slip out of place once or twice during each use requiring me to break my stride to fix it. The wheel is a two edged sword -- great for edging, but bad for getting into really tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: iPatch

customer_reviews.title: I used the recommended grade and size
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but be prepared to buy LOTS of line. I went through four spools in one trimming. Grant you the edging had not been done for a week, but COME ON! I used the recommended grade and size. The trimmer ate through line like it was apple pie and ice cream at a county fair.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Rosenoff

customer_reviews.title: Eats string like crazy
customer_reviews.text: We went thru 3 spools of string on 1st use, edging the driveway and sidewalk. Spools don't last! Our old B&D edger was dual string and 1 spool lasted several uses. Also, the top handle does not swivel when you are trimming versus edging, making the unit hard to hold while edging. It's like you're operating the controls upside down.
customer_reviews.author: CaringConsumer

customer_reviews.title: This is really lightweight and works well on trimming around the house
customer_reviews.text: It's not a critical point, but I wish the trimmer line housing held more line, so it didn't need to be reloaded so often. My suggestion is to purchase several of the refills, so that you can pre-load the spools to have enough for your current task. I try to reload them when I am finished, so that I have them ready for next time.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre Cummins

customer_reviews.title: Worst Trimmer we've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift based off good reviews but have been Severely disappointed. We have a small yard and go through 2 spools each time which are $8 each 😡 It self feeds so it's constantly chopping off the wire & flips it at your legs. 😳 Today, the spool kept spinning and got all tangled, an entire new spool wasted. So frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: sidboxer

customer_reviews.title: Best on the Market, hands down....
customer_reviews.text: Wow, i bought another brand of mower and it worked for a while but this little light wright powerhouse will tear down weeds like they are short yard grass. This trimer edger is amazing,. Edging will blow you away. i didn't expect this trimmer edger to be that powerful. I am more than impressed. I have changed my power tool and yard working equipment to Black and Decker. I am more than well pleased. Great product more than worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie W. Gorham

customer_reviews.title: It's Junk - DEAD!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the GH900 back in June 2016, and the motor just died today. It was running perfectly, then I unplugged it from back yard outlet to move to front yard, and it just wouldn't start. Smells like motor burnt out. I was using it for maybe 10 minutes. Probably a motor made in China. So I guess that's the going rate of duration for yard trimming for a Black and Decker cheap motor. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Strobel

customer_reviews.title: strong motor while it did last, auto feed is a piece of 💩.
customer_reviews.text: I've had WorxGT battery operated unit before this one. The batteries would no longer hold a charge so I bought this. Being corded, it was much more powerfull than the Worx unit, but used more line in less than one year than in 5 years of useing the Worx. The whole issue with spitting out line is a serious design flaw. I couldn't even complete the edging, let alone the weed waking with a single full spool. Then 11 months after having it the motor has seized up. Going to go with another brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Donahou

customer_reviews.title: Good trimmer, mine had a defective switch but was able to repair it. If you don't mind dragging a power cord go for it.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, mine was slightly defective, and the switch failed very early in it's use. Fortunately it uses the same switch at the trigger as for changing modes via rotation of the trimmer head. I literally have no idea what the other switch does? Maybe it was for limiting string output during the other mode, but I switched the two switches and it has been working fine for 2 seasons. I'm on my second spool of trimmer line so havn't used it too much but any way pretty reliable. Works every time you plug it in if you can stand dragging out the cord every time...
customer_reviews.author: Philonious

customer_reviews.title: Is something wrong with the design of this string trimmer
customer_reviews.text: In my first usage of the trimmer; and it was the front yard only; which isn't a big area, I used the supplied line plus a full resupply of the line. If this is what happens with the auto-feed feature, I don't like it. If I'm doing something wrong or it was designed to eat the line, then the selling of replacement line is the company's new profit center.
customer_reviews.author: dennykochan

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: This is my second string trimmer. This is the only one I could find that got decent reviews. My last one (the same one) stopped after some years and I replaced it with the same one. The only thing I don't like is that I cannot figure out how to remove the guide wheel and it gets in my way. Otherwise it works well and the height of the handle is adjustable. .
customer_reviews.author: ahusberg

customer_reviews.title: Fair, not great.
customer_reviews.text: The automatic line dispensing feature is a good idea but kind of finicky. I'm not sure I've quite figured it out but it seems like it just releases a little line every time you stop and start, whether it's needed or not. I guess wasting line is a good way of selling more of their refill spools? I often wish I could just bump the trimmer on the ground to dispense a little line, like normal. It's an okay trimmer though.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, pick something else
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Black and Decker GH710 That failed after three years (motor bearings shot) The previous model was dual line, and just plain worked better than the single line trimmer. I originally thought the wire cutting guide on the other model was silly, turns out it worked way better than the wheel on this new model. But the real problem is that the line ran out after 6 weeks of use, I got a year on a spool on the old one. Seems like this unit is designed to go through line as fast as possible.
customer_reviews.author: J H.

customer_reviews.title: Decent cheap weed eater
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a decent, cheap weed eater. The power connector is recessed for some reason, so a lot of my extensions cords did not fit--and the one recommended by Amazon to be 'purchased together' also didn't fit. The first one arrived and we ran it for about 3 minutes before it started 'pulsing'. We turned it off, checked the power connections, and hooked up a tester to the extension cord. Everything checked out, so we plugged it back in. It ran for another 90 seconds or so and then died. A replacement is on its way. UPDATE: The replacement arrived and I've used it for about an hour with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing...
customer_reviews.text: After spending five or six years with a gas powered weeder/edger that we could never get started and then had to fight to keep started, I finally gave up and bought this electric Black & Decker based on all the good reviews it had. It does not disappoint. I do not have an acreage, but I have a large corner lot and it is completely fenced so there is plenty to edget. I have good electrical outlet access and a couple hundred-foot extension cords, so this baby works like a charm. I love both the weeding and the ending functions . It is lightweight the folds up really quite small for very convenient storage
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Great power tool, gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Nice power tool, does the job! I've been using this for the past two months with no complaints. I've been working it in periods of no more thatn 20 consecutive minutes, with 10 minute breaks. After about 6 of these sessions I finally ran down the line, this was also because I did a lot of hedge trimming an ran into some grass that was right on rocks. Automatic feeding system works alright, length and weight is perfect, the little wheel on the base is great for hedge trimming. Easy to take apart for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Lighter Weight and More Powerful than Battery Version
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. We had the similar model with a battery but it took a bad fall and we replaced with the corded version. It is significantly more powerful and much lighter. The cost is pretty much the same once you factor in the extension cord. But I cannot emphasize enough the difference the power makes. I did have some issues with the spool going out too fast. I had to open up the feeder and rewind it a little bit. That fixed the issue. Pros: *More powerful than battery version *Lightweight *Collapses for easy storage Cons: *Corded so you need a long extension cord
customer_reviews.author: J. Camson

customer_reviews.title: The trimmer runs well, but I was running through ...
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer runs well, but I was running through the trimmer line in two the three minutes. After using 6 expensive spools and following everything in the instructions, I tried to find something online to help me and was directed to a help center 250 miles away. So I returned it within my 30 day window and will try another, hopefully less problematic brand.
customer_reviews.author: animal fanatic

customer_reviews.title: wow this didn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: used for less than 6 spools worth of line in less than a year and either switch failed or something else in trimmer, electric cord tested with circular saw cord is fine had a weed eater for 14- 15 years this is a disappointment and since I didn't buy from local hardware store that is the black and decker service store I just bought a cheaper B&D model from Amazon again hope this lasts
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the design the weight
customer_reviews.text: I love the design the weight , the cutting angles, etc. The bad deign is the auto feed. to trim with this you can move about two feet on Bermuda grass then you must stop to allow the line to feed if you go much further the line will break off and you will have to remove the spool to get the line back through the hole. Once you learn how often to stop it works fine but is annoying to stop that frequently.
customer_reviews.author: GJ

customer_reviews.title: PASS THIS ONE BY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have owned a Blacker and Decker weed eater before, so when it finally broke.... I thought this model would be comparable ...so when it was received, I got out there and was happy with it for the first month. After experiencing a few problems with the line...I finally threw it in the trash today. ..it is far FAR more problematic than I ever thought Black and Decker would ever manufacture. Pass this one by!!!
customer_reviews.author: K G, MD

customer_reviews.title: Strings withdraws often
customer_reviews.text: Immediately after taking it out of the box and using it the string drew into the spool with their winding of string. I tried at least 10 times to wind it properly and still withdrew back into the spool. When it withdraws I had to stop pull off the spool and rewind the string, this take up to 5 minutes each time. Almost every minute it withdrew into the spool. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: jam

customer_reviews.title: So far I am rather disappointed with this unit
customer_reviews.text: this unit has plenty of power but the handle has a habit of releasing itself a lot and after a couple hours use the unit started smoking and got really hot around the trigger and I had to unplug the unit to shut it off. I called the B&G helpline and was told they would send me a ups label to send it to a repair shop where it would either be repaired or replaced. So far I am rather disappointed with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: John Brashears

customer_reviews.title: Ok Product.
customer_reviews.text: The motor is strong, cut through almost everything. It's very short, I'm 6ft tall, and even fully extended, I had to hunch over. So now the big negative, the adjustable handle on mine was warped and broken, any pressure I put on it, it would collapse, making it impossible to control. Tried contacting the company, and they said since I used it, they would not replace it...
customer_reviews.author: Neil Packer Jr

customer_reviews.title: Died after 1 1/2 years -- ugg. Not user friendly -- ugg
customer_reviews.text: Okay -- it has been a 1 and 1/2 and it died. What a waste of money and a ton of frustration. And I have a teeny-tiny yard. --- This is what I wrote a view months after I bought it: It is practically impossible for me to put in replacement string cartridges. I hate the usability on this product. Does not work as expected. Yuck. I went cheap and ended up with cheap. Advice ... buy the next one up in price .... and good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho Guy

customer_reviews.title: Spool disappeared in about 10 minutes of my first use.
customer_reviews.text: Spool disappeared in about 10 minutes of my first use. I cleared out some light weeds growing up on the garage and then edged our walkway about 20 feet long (on one side) before the entire spool had disappeared. Wasn't prepared for that and am pretty disappointed. Will be looking for another trimmer now that isn't going to eat spool like razor blades if this continues. Other than that, it does a really good job at downing weeds and grass when there is spooling in it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Pappas

customer_reviews.title: Eats string like crazy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old Weed Eater with a bump feed that fell apart after 15 or so seasons. This trimmer seems to do a pretty good job as both a trimmer and an edger but it goes through 2 or 3 spools of string each time I use it. Guess I'll have to practice winding my own spools because I sure won't be able to afford to keep it in pre-wound ones.
customer_reviews.author: Josie's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Precision cutting and powerful.  The handle needs a more durable locking mechanism, keeps slipping.
customer_reviews.text: Have used it twice to trim the grass and weeds around the house. It cuts very well as intended. Has plenty of power to get through any thick grass with ease. The only down side is the handle. No matter what position I lock the handle in, after several minutes of use it will slip out of the locked position and rotated all the way up. May have to use duck tape to lock it in place. Overall, it cuts with precision and ease.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a small lawn.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a small lawn, no loud noise of a 2 cycle engine, no gas to fill up, no seasonal maintenance like changing oil, etc. It's also much nicer to use on my hands, since there is less weight and less vibrations since there is no gasoline engine, just a simple electric motor. The telescoping design makes it easy to pack away in the garage or adjust for use.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Oberlee

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well for the money-does seem to eat up the string cartridges quickly, but we had to use it along the bottom of a wood fence, so I imagine that's part of the reason. The replacement cartridges snap in pretty easily-not too expensive I guess (about $3 each). I'm sure using bulk string and winding your own would be cheaper, but neither one of us has that kind of patience! But it does the job, not too difficult to maneuver, and cleans up the small area we need it for-wouldn't think it would hold up to extended heavy usage.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Don'twaste your time/money.
customer_reviews.text: The string guard won't seat properly on the machine. One has to push it through two slots, which end in a way that the guard cannot be pushed in far enough to be properly affixed. Poor engineering. I sent it back. Sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Petoq

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker Weed Eater
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I can not start the pull cord weed eater anymore. I needed something so I looked into electric ones. I choose this one because of the price and the good reviews. I can do yard work again. It's lightweight too. I'll recommend this weed eater for anyone. May 4, 2018 Update I've had it almost a year. It is still going strong. I've had no problems. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Romero

customer_reviews.title: Black & Decker GH900 Gh900 String Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second GH900 Trimmer by Black & Decker. The wheel for edging is a big plus and also this model is more powerful than their cheaper mode. I find it much lighter and easier to use that my gas mode even with the cord issue.
customer_reviews.author: tc

customer_reviews.title: this was perfect and I haven't had any problems with it at ...
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of this and needed to replace it, this was perfect and I haven't had any problems with it at all. I rethread the line myself, as that's cheaper than buying the spools, and I can not be happier with how easy that is. I had many problems with my old one and debated buying another black and decker--but this did not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Dscribble05

customer_reviews.title: ... this in 2015 and it has been nothing but annoying so far
customer_reviews.text: I got this in 2015 and it has been nothing but annoying so far. The spool feed always comes out too much or too little. I've tried their brand of spools for the string line and still nothing works. It just sits in my garage collecting dust. The good part is the adjustability of the handle. If you're short or big, the handle can be customized a lot.
customer_reviews.author: No Lie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My old electric Black & Decker weed whacker finally gave up after 10yrs so it was an easy decision to order another Black & Decker product. I use it on two properties with no problems. It is light and was easy to adjust for comfort. I like that the line is fed automatically so no "bumping" to get more line. I had no problem winding new line on the spool either. Overall a great product for small to medium sized yards.
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, aside from two very minor issues.
customer_reviews.text: The spool that comes with this weed eater is pretty awful, butis a great replacement so no problem there. The bigger issue is that it's hard to get most extension cords to plug into this thing. It only has two prongs, but if your cord is meant for three prongs, it will be difficult (although possible, for me) to fit the cord on there. The prongs are kind of sunk into the handle of the weed eater, leaving little room for the three prong extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: ErPort

customer_reviews.title: You'll Go Broke Paying For Replacement Spools ... It's Like Buying A Printer and Then Getting Gouged on the Ink. Ouch!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to skip charging my battery twice to finish weed eating my small yard, so I bought this wired one instead. The power is awesome, but the guide wheel is useless for edging a straight line. They used to have a guide wire that was more useful in keeping the edger at the right distance from the edge. And the BIGGEST complaint of all is that I used 1 and 1/2 spool line to edge my yard once ... that's about $5 worth of line if you buy the B&D replacements ... and that's crazy.
customer_reviews.author: JSB

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Wish it had dual line!
customer_reviews.text: I got another electric trimmer from B&D based on the wonderful longevity and performance I got from my last one. The only reason why this new one gets 4 stars instead of 5 is because they do not make it on a double-string format. The double-string cuts your time edging in HALF. At any rate, this unit worked wonderfully the first two edgings. Time will tell if it is still working as well a year from now, but as of today, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: The A.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you take your blood pressure meds before even attempting to use this product!
customer_reviews.text: Probably the worst $50 I've ever spent. It worked fine the first 2 times that I trimmed my very small yard. The problems started on the 3rd time. The automatic feeder system apparently stopped working. It would do one of two things: 1.) refuse to feed, which meant stopping every 20 feet to take it apart to feed more wire or 2.) refuse to STOP feeding, in which case it went through a $7 spool of wire in about 30 seconds. I have $130 into this trimmer and spools of wire for about 2 1/4 yard trimmings. This product is absolutely horrible.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!  Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 70 year old woman with a bad back, and I did most of my half acre yard in one day with this powerhouse. Back in the day I had a gas model with blades, and my favorite job was tearing through my forest whacking down small trees and huge amounts of blackberry bushes. This is almost as much fun and SO much easier. Don't expect it to get those small trees and I wouldn't want to tackle thick berry vines, but for everything else it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today and took it out to see how well it works and all I can say is WOW! This thing is great, I got my moneys worth when I bought this. Ya can't go wring on this one. Powerful, light weight and easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: montana3802

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I don't need a super powerful machine, so gas was too much, and battery power can be sketchy. I hate dragging around the power cord, but at least it has consistent power. I turned it sideways to use the edger and it works fine, but two words of advice: wear pants and sunglasses or safety glasses. Not only will you look cool, but you'll also have plant spray all over your face.
customer_reviews.author: Smarmo

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Welm i had my first season. This little bugger worked well out of the box. The line continuously feeds as needed but read the instructions. The line must have some inertia feed or something lots of stop and go uses up the line quickly. Also easy to replace spools. Just know the spools are tight and if you slip it instantly unravels. All in all very satisfied The price was very competitive with the box store
customer_reviews.author: Georgios

customer_reviews.title: This trimmer eats a full spool every time I do ...
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer eats a full spool every time I do our small yard. I should have used right away so I could return it but I was foolish enough to trust Black & Decker. That won't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: LON

customer_reviews.title: Amazing power! Love it
customer_reviews.text: Amazing power! Love it. Just got it and went to work in my yard and the neighbors who's yard was FULL of overgrown weeds, grass and other bushes. This thing cut through it all with ease. Easy to use and lightweight, didn't kill my back after I was finished. The ability to adjust the height is key. Highly recommend this trimmer. Oh, the auto-feeder function was wonderful, with my old trimmer I would stop every 5 minutes to feed more line, never had to stop once, this trimmer fed the line out when needed, never noticed it slow down. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Glen T.

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse, 6.0 Beast Mode!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely suggest getting this 6.0 amp beast. This thing is a workhorse and can get through almost anything. I have very thick grass along my fence line and it had been growing for a few weeks and this thing cut right through it. I have had the 4 and 5 amp versions before and they just don't work as well.
customer_reviews.author: toddt0606DC

customer_reviews.title: If $25/year is acceptable for you...
customer_reviews.text: I always take a low percentage of negative reviews as user error or lemons, so went ahead & purchased via Amazon. While worked was acceptable for trimming/edging, line replacement/feeding & ergonomics. Worked for 2 years then simply quit. Works out as $25/year. Intentional depreciation B&D? Acceptable return? Not for me, but maybe my expectations are too high. Written as I sit in lawn chair after troubleshooting as recommended to no avail, so have 1/2 way done yard.
customer_reviews.author: Caninephile

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: The deal breaker for me was that the handle adjustment pops out of place. I can only use it at one angle. Very lightweight but all plastic. Plenty of power though. Another negative: it used line at a very fast pace. I did like the wheel that helps when edging sidewalks. I would return, but burned the box.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma on the Edge

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: My old Black & decker trimmer kept jamming after 6 years of service. I bought this GH900 trimmer and noticed a gain in power with the cutting. Highly recommend this trimmer the only downside is the trimmer line they supply isn't a full reel it will run out pretty quick. I would recommend getting the 3 pack of trimmer line with the trimmer so you ready when you have to replace it. If your concern with cost then buy the 3LB spool of trimmer line and wrap your own line on the spool.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trimmer on 3/21/2015. I absolutely loved it. Light weight, effective. However, it is almost two years exactly and the warranty just went out so of course the motor froze up. I have an average size yard here in Texas so it was not due to overuse. Although I am disappointed, it will not stop me from ordering another one. It just makes my life easier. Hope the new one works as well.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Texas

customer_reviews.title: Cord comes unplugged, instructions insufficient, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This product sucks, the cord comes loose every time from the outlet on top of the handle, and the only benefit is that is doesn’t use fossil fuel and it was lighter than my last weed whacker. I wouldn’t recommend it unless you are on a tight budget with a very long extension cord. They shouldn’t even put the Black and Decker brand name on this product. The instructions were also a joke, they were not helpful at all. The sidewalk edging feature is only useful because the product is so light weight.
customer_reviews.author: KJM

customer_reviews.title: This replaced a 12yo model that finally gave up. ...
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a 12yo model that finally gave up. It is balanced well, adjusts well (I am 6'-6"), and operates smoothly. Took a few minutes to get used to the edger wheel guide, but it works. The motor runs slower when used as an edger, I suppose to keep rocks from flying up badly.
customer_reviews.author: KyKz

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS TO REPLACE ONE THAT I DESTROYED THROUGH ABUSE ON MY PART
customer_reviews.text: GREAT FOR SMALL YARDS bought this as a replacement for one that came with my Black & Decker MTE912 12-Inch Electric 3-in-1 Trimmer/Edger and Mower, it was a perfect fit after 1 modification i had to use the smaller guard from my old trimmer . i used the living daylights out of the old one and i was very pleased with it so i had to replace it. this is the perfect replacement
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for $50
customer_reviews.text: It was fast and easy to assemble. Only required a phillips screwdriver for a single screw. Took it outside and attached it to my 100' outdoor extension cord without a problem. My previous weedwacker had a stronger motor than this model, but it handled everything my other one did. I am very pleased with it. My only grumble, and it is slight, is the black handle changed position while I was using it. I will see if there is a way to tighten that better tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Lab Lover

customer_reviews.title: It just stopped working suddenly like there was a bad switch or the motor was ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine died after the third time using it. It just stopped working suddenly like there was a bad switch or the motor was completely dead. Since I had it for only 2 months, I took it to an Authorized B&D Service Center today. The service agent ordered a new replacement no charge and it will be delivered to me in 7 days. I hope I will have better luck with the replacement. My previous $19 B&D string trimmer purchased from Home Depot lasted from 2003 to 2015.
customer_reviews.author: From Tampa

customer_reviews.title: It is extremely powerful and uses a good bit of line as others have commented
customer_reviews.text: No problems here. I've used this GH900 trimmer for about three months, and this product has been up to every challenge albeit mostly light yard trimming here in south LA. It is extremely powerful and uses a good bit of line as others have commented, but it works extremely well for the price (I paid $34.00.) Dragging an extension cord around is a necessary hassle, but the auto. feed system more than offsets that little inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Delton P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Effective Garden Tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool; I am a 62 year old female who has NEVER used a weed wacker of any kind myself. It is incredibly easy to assemble, attach the handle and go. It is lightweight, very easy to maneuver, and it does a fabulous job of cutting and trimming. The issue of line feeding that I had read about for many models is not the case here. It self feeds with precision and i have not had any issues with the line at all. Great product and well priced.
customer_reviews.author: Maya

customer_reviews.title: This trimmer was better than I thought it was going to be
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer was better than I thought it was going to be. We do not have a lot to trim, but we do need a trimmer. So no more than we use it we got this. AFS automatic feed system ensures continual work without bumping or having to stop Power Drive Transmission prevents bogging down Lightweight ergonomic design with adjustable height and pivoting handle The 6.5 amp motor and high torque transmission provide maximum performance
customer_reviews.author: pam d.

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this until the 3rd time I used it
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this until the 3rd time I used it, the part where the spool is and the plastic holding it in securely was broken and popped right off. it shot off with an exploding sound. The whole thing was busted and almost hit me in the head. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: This weed whacker didn't even last a year. Purchased in August, which is the end of the summer, didn't even make it through this year... Died end of June. I would think it should last at least one whole summer. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish it wasn't orange but...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cheap, electric weed whacker to handle my small front yard and edge along the sidewalk. This is easy to use and powerful enough for handling my neighbors' invasive tomato vines and that big bush with all the dead birds in it. Obviously, you should buy a long outdoor extension cord and a three-pack of replacement spools. One spool will usually last me three to four chop sessions.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, while it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in August 2016, loved it, worked great as a trimmer and really liked the edger feature. Pulled it out in April 2017, first time to use it in the spring season and it died while edging my sidewalks. Seems to be an electrical short or something. Has a two year warrany, but closest authorized repair center is 90 miles away. Still debating whether it is worth repairing, even if under warranty, because the price was so low. I don't think I would buy Black and Decker again.
customer_reviews.author: mom2x2

customer_reviews.title: Whacking Weeds Couldn't be Any Easier
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were easy to follow, making quick work with attaching the handle and guard. Handle easily extends to adjust the height. The trimmer is a work horse and light enough to manage my large yard. As a woman, this is important. I can't wait to try the edger.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Mom

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work just as good as my old two string Grass Hog. It runs quieter than the old one. The method to flip between edging and trimming it not as successful as in the past. Instead of a release button you now tighten and loosen and this slows you down.
customer_reviews.author: Rdkam

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Typical piece of Black & Decker junk. Works for a while, then breaks. Even while it worked, it went through pre-loaded string spools like crazy. But don't worry -- they'll sell you more!! Back to Ryobi for me!!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Professor

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because my home lite trimmer broke and kept spitting out more line than I needed. After ONE USE this product started doing the same thing. Update: I got it to stop spitting out so much line and it's working pretty well now. I did have to stop a few times to pull out a little bit more line but other than that works well.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: A good machine
customer_reviews.text: My original trimmer is Black & Decker. After more than 10 years of use, still good but the power plug got loose and difficult to connect to the outlet. So I bought the same brand. It is very good. The wheel is a good function to trim. The string comes with this machine is much more strong than what I usually buy from Home Depot. If Black & Decker can tell me which brand of this string, will be much appreciated. Very good trimmer for my garden work.
customer_reviews.author: Mic

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through everything
customer_reviews.text: I have a very uneven backyard so there is no way that I can use a mower of any kind. I like not having to mess with gas and pull starting. The trim line cuts through all of my weeds and bracken ferns. The auto feed is super. No more banging the trimmer on the ground to advance the line. Glad I bought this so I can keep the grass short to discourage ticks.
customer_reviews.author: E. Comella

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic weed wacker has more power than you will ever need. I was always spending more time trying to get my sear wacker started than what i spent trimming. The reason i only gave it 4 stars the first time i used it i got my yard half done and i was out of string. I figured there was maybe a foot on there you think they could give you a full roll for this price. If your getting up in age like me this is what you need the edger works like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: ernie

customer_reviews.title: Good trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This has been my first summer using this trimmer, and it has worked great. It's very tough (I am abusive) and cuts through weeds and grass very well. The only problem I have with it is the auto-feed. Sometimes it's not so "auto" and it can be a little frustrating. I can deal with it though, good product.
customer_reviews.author: Ree

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER String Trimmer, 6.5-Amp, 14-Inch (GH900)
product_meta.description:
The BLACK+DECKER GH900 14" 6.5-Amp Corded String Trimmer and Edger is built with a lightweight ergonomic design with adjustable height and pivoting handle positions which give maximum comfort and control. The 6.5-Amp motor and high torque transmission provide maximum performance when trimming through the toughest weeds, grass and overgrowth and the Power Drive Transmission prevents bogging down in heavy grass and weeds. This unit features AFS automatic feed system which ensures continual work without bumping or having to stop to feed the spool. It is designed with 2-in-1 easy conversion wheeled edging- just rotate to convert from trimmer to edger and the Smart Edge mode gives more control and accuracy in edge mode for straighter and cleaner edging results. Commonly used for trimming grass in hard to reach areas where mowers can not cut and for maintenance edging along hard surfaces. Includes: (1) GH900 Trimmer/Hedger, (1) AF-100 spool, (1) Auxiliary Handle and (1) Guard.

BRAND STORY
By Black & Decker
feature_bullets: AFS automatic feed system ensures continual work without bumping or having to stop
The 6.5-Amp motor and high torque transmission provide MAXimum performance
Power Source : Corded-Electric.13 inch cut path gets the job done fast
Included Components: GH900 6.5 Amp Trimmer/Edger, (1) AF-100, (1) Auxiliary Handle, (1) Guard; Power Source: Corded
AFS automatic feed system ensures continual work without bumping or having to stop
Power Drive Transmission prevents bogging down
Lightweight ergonomic design with adjustable height and pivoting handle
The 6.5 amp motor and high torque transmission provide maximum performance

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,652 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
